result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th). The defendant was found guilty of both charges. Because Wisconsin law provides for only one penalty even if there is a conviction on both, no additional penalty has been imposed as a result of the second charge.

  • James D Howe was found guilty of OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • James D Howe was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Sentencing hearing moved up per request of parties.
Sentencing hearing on September 21, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
for release pending appeal;filed by Atty Short
Verdict Count 1 - GUILTY signed, not guilty not signed, Verdict Count 2 - GUILTY signed, not guilty not signed

Defendant in court with Attorney Michael J. Short.  Shaun W O'Connell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James D Howe in court with attorney Michael J. Short. Prosecuting Atty Shaun W O'Connell appeared for State of Wisconsin. Ct. reporter:  Heather Kieta - Ex. 1-3 marked, prior to start of trial. Ctrm w/o final jury panel present.  Parties review preliminary jury instructions & no objections were made. ADA OConnell requests to be able to show map (marked as ex. 1 but not recd yet by ct.) during opening statement.  Atty. Short objects.  Ct. overrules objection & grants OConnells request to show map.  Final jury panel present in Ctrm @9:04 am. Final jury panel sworn by Clerk. Preliminary Instructions given by Ct.
Opening Stmt by ADA OConnell @ 9:17 am. Opening Stmt by Atty. Short @ 9:28 am.
States Case
Timothy Ringgenberg, duly sworn & testifies. Direct by ADA OConnell. ADA OConnell moves Ex. 1 into evidence.  No objection by Atty. Short. Ex. 1 recd by Ct. Cross by Atty. Short.
Brian Thompson, duly sworn & testifies. Direct by ADA OConnell. Cross by Atty. Short.
Luke Skowron, duly sworn & testifies.  Direct by ADA OConnell. Cross by Atty. Short.
Don Penly, Madison police officer, duly sworn & testifies. Direct by ADA OConnell. Cross by Atty. Short. Redirect by ADA OConnell. Recross by Atty. Short.
Jury excused for break @ 10:27 am. Ct. recesses @ 10:29 am
Ct. reconvenes @ 10:50 am. Ct Reporter change @ 10:54 am  Reporter:  Colleen Clark  Jury panel present @ 10:55 am
Russell Pollard, Madison police officer, duly sworn & testifies. Direct by ADA OConnell. ADA OConnell moves Ex. 2 into evidence. No objection by Atty. Short. Ex. 2 recd by Ct. Cross by Atty. Short. Ex. 4&5 marked.  Atty. Short moves Ex. 4&5 into evidence. No objection by ADA OConnell. Ex. 4&5 recd. Redirect by ADA OConnell. Recross by Atty. Short.
Jury excused for break @ 11:35 am. Ct. recesses @ 11:37 am.
Reconvene @ 12:49 pm.  Jury panel present @ 12:51 pm.  ADA OConnell asked the Ct. to read stipulations reached by counsel.  Ct. reads stipulations to the jury. 
Thomas Neuser, Wl State Laboratory of Hygiene, duly sworn & testifies.  Direct by ADA OConnell. ADA OConnell moves Ex. 3 into evidence. No objection by Atty. Short. Ex. 3 recd by Ct. No cross by Atty. Short. 
State rests @ 1:07 pm
Jury excused for break @ 1:10 pm.  Atty. Short moves to dismiss & makes argument for such. Argument by ADA OConnell. Ct. does not make decision on this now as ct. needs to research on history of 15TR5161.  Ct. has colloquy with defendant about right to testify.  Defn. decides not to testify.  Defense will not have any witnesses & will not present any evidence.  Jury instruction conference held between Ct. and counsel. Counsel sees no errors in final jury instructions.  Jury present in ctrm. @ 2:03 pm.  Final jury instructions read to jury by Ct.
Closing Argument by ADA OConnell @ 2:18 pm.  Closing Argument by Atty. Short @ 2:26 pm. Rebuttal Argument by ADA OConnell @ 2:35 pm. Alternate juror # 2 @ drawn by Clerk & excused by Ct. @ 2:44 pm. Ct. continued giving final jury instructions. Baliff duly sworn by clerk. Jury removed for deliberations @ 2:48 pm. Parties discuss exhibits & giving them to jury.  Ct. rules that if they ask all exhibits will go back.  No objection by counsel.  
Bailiff notifies Ct. that jury has reached a verdict @ 3:53 pm. Ctrm. outside presence of jury @ 4:00 pm.  Regarding 15TR5161:  Ct. orders case re-opened and rules that default judgment shall be vacated.  Ct. conducts refusal hearing. Ct. finds that motion to dismiss refusal is denied. Atty. Short withdraws motion to reopen and requests that default stay in place. Ct. grants this request.  Jury present in ctrm. @ 4:16 pm. 
Verdicts read by Ct as follows:  
	Ct. 1:  GUILTY
	Ct. 2:  GUILTY
Jury polled by Ct.  Jury excused by Ct. @ 4:21 pm.  Based on verdicts, ADA OConnell moves for judgment on verdicts and requests bail revoked.  Atty. Short requests that bail is not revoked due to case having appellate issues.  Atty. Short requests that defn. is released on bail pending appeal.  ADA OConnell makes argument against defn. being released on bail. Ct. finds & adjudges defn. guilty on cts. 1 & 2 as charged. Ct. denies defn.s request to be released on bail pending appeal. Ct. orders bail revoked and orders defn. into custody.

Defendant in court with Attorney Michael J. Short.  Shaun W O'Connell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James D Howe in court with attorney Michael J. Short. Prosecuting Atty Shaun W O'Connell appeared for State of Wisconsin. Discussion with parties regarding witness lists.  Stipulation regarding blood draw and chain of custody discussed.  Stipulation regarding prior offenses. Ct. accepts defendants agreement to prior offense stipulation between counsel.  Ct. addresses possible impeachment of defendant.  ADA OConnell does not intend to impeach defendant with any prior convictions if defendant chooses to testify.   Prior convictions of witnesses discussed and impeachment of witnesses.  States motions in limine accepted by the court. Ct. orders State can not mention defendants prior convictions.  Ct. also orders all witnesses excluded from ctrm. until they testify. Ct. will decide 15TR5161 case based on evidence at trial & ct. will conduct a court trial on 15TR5161.
Jurors present at 9:41 am. Introduction by Ct.  Prospective panel sworn by Clerk.  23 prospective jurors chosen:  Jurors 1-23 seated.  Ct questions panel. Juror #17 excused by Ct @ 10:19 am. Juror #24 seated as replacement. Juror #24 excused by Ct.@ 10:21 am.  Juror #25 seated as replacement.  Voir Dire by ADA OConnell for Plaintiff. Voir Dire by Atty Short for Defendant.  Voir dire concludes  jurors not chosen excused @ 10:53 am. Strikes exercised by counsel  5 each. No Batson objections to peremptory challenges. Jurors not chosen for final panel excused @ 11:01 am. 13 jurors chosen for panel.  Ct. admonished jurors.  All jurors excused @ 11:05 am.
